thread.title_full: Tatum Takes IU to Sweep in Champaign

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Tatum Takes IU to Sweep in Champaign
text:
Tatum Takes IU to Sweep in Champaign
The Indiana Hoosiers volleyball team achieved a historic victory, sweeping Illinois in Champaign for the first time since 2007, with set scores of 25-18, 25-21, and 25-18. This win not only ended a 15-match losing streak at Huff Hall but also marked their seventh road conference victory this season, setting a new program record for Big Ten wins away from home. Avry Tatum led the offense with 13 kills, while senior Candela Alonso-Corcelles made history as the program's winningest player in NCAA history with her 75th career victory. Freshman Teodora Krickovic contributed significantly with 39 assists and three aces.
- IU's victory marks their first road sweep of Illinois in program history.
- Alonso-Corcelles secured her 75th career win, setting a new program record since its NCAA era began in 1981.
- The win ties IU's total at 23 this season, matching the program's single-season record.
- IU achieved a total of nine service aces, with only one service error in 74 attempts.
- Indiana moved to a 7-2 road conference record, solidifying their position in the Big Ten.
- The Hoosiers are poised to close the regular season with a chance for their best conference finish in history.
IU faces No. 11 Purdue next, where a win would secure the program's best-ever Big Ten finish (3rd or T-3rd) and set a new record for total wins in a season at 24.
Bottom LineThis milestone victory underscores the strength and momentum of the Indiana volleyball program as they approach the season's conclusion. It highlights both their veteran leadership and emerging talent, aiming for further historic achievements in the coming matches.
Read more at Indiana University Athletics
